website_summaries.verdict: The Saucony Triumph 11 is a neutral shoe for road running. The shoe delivers a great combination of comfort, cushioning and protection. With the technologies attached to this shoe, the Triumph 11 will not disappoint when used for daily training and long runs. Based on reviews, the shoe is indeed a successful release.
pros: The shoe has a great cushioning based on some reviews
The plush and comfortable fit gained positive feedback from the users
Many runners were impressed by how durable the shoe is
The shoe is comfortable to wear and breathable enough
cons: Not flexible enough according to some runners
Some mentioned that the Saucony Triumph 11 is too narrow for them

customer_reviews.title: these were purchased April 7 of 2017 and after only 3mo and 150mi of running this is what they look like..
customer_reviews.text: Have purchased numerous different types of Saucony shoes and all have lasted me for well over a year....these were purchased April 7 of 2017 and after only 3mo and 150mi of running this is what they look like....I have Zealots that are 3yr old that dont look this bad....without a doubt the webbing is very poor quality and does not hold up.....AVOID!!!
customer_reviews.author: msp116

customer_reviews.title: Just fabulous
customer_reviews.text: When it comes to running shoes Saucony shoes are the one-brand I trust the most. I've tried to go into other shoes but I always somehow end up coming back to this specific model and maker. For that reason whenever these shoes are available in my size and at a significant discount I purchase a minimum of two at a time. I try and change the shoes every 500 to 800 miles. I will continue to wear these and buy these
customer_reviews.author: MickeyMouse124

customer_reviews.title: Same fit, lesser workmanship than prior year model
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been wearing these shoes for several years, getting a newer model each year. This pair wasn’t made as well as previous shoes as the sole came unglued. It was easier to repair than to send back though. Update: Should have sent these back. With relatively little distance - the soles are very worn and the shoes are coming unglued. I’ll skip the Triumph 11 next time for another model.
customer_reviews.author: Rick G

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Shoes
customer_reviews.text: Fit and finish first rate. Very comfortable from the first wear. Neon Glows at twilight and looks great. The only down side is these are not very durable. I bought them for walking the dog and walk about 3 miles a day. Got them September 26th and after only a month the tread is showing significant wear. Estimate I have around 90 miles on them. Uppers still look like new.
customer_reviews.author: Brit C Power

customer_reviews.title: Great Traditional Saucony.  Newer Not Always Better.
customer_reviews.text: My favorite "Triumph" of all time, and now getting harder to find, and more expensive, unfortunately, as model ages. Thank heavens for Amazon. Replacement models seem to be more designed for fashion and modern appearance, than function, IMHO. Wish they would "remake".
customer_reviews.author: kholmes

customer_reviews.title: Didn't like them
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love these shoes, but they are too narrow in the toe box and gave a blister. I wore the Triumph 9's for years and then they stopped making them, so I tried these. They aren't the same. I ended up with the Brook's Beast model and love them!
customer_reviews.author: Molstx

customer_reviews.title: Feet change with age.
customer_reviews.text: My last 6 or 7 Pairs of running shoes have been Sauconys in size 11. I recently got a pair of rides in size 11 that were a little small. When I ordered these triumphs I went up in size to 11 1/2...perfect. I don't know if my feet grew or if saucony has reduced there sizing but these are perfect and fit great.
customer_reviews.author: Hutch

customer_reviews.title: Good-looking shoe, but a tight fit.
customer_reviews.text: Normally I am a huge Saucony fanboy, and I especially love the Triumph series. These however fit a bit tight, which is unusual considering Saucony 11.5 usually fits me like a glove. The shoes look nice and are very well made, but I wish I had bought 1/2 size larger.
customer_reviews.author: Hobie CatTop Contributor: Boxing

customer_reviews.title: Love these shoes
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes, it takes a couple of weeks to break them in and with my first pair I had some mild abrasions from the exterior on my interior arch area, it eventually worked it’s way out and they are super comfy for a 6’4” 250 lb guy
customer_reviews.author: J. Dilla

customer_reviews.title: poor wear
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 pairs as had been so happy with previous ones. I used the first pair and am now switching to the second pair and - This pair - Padding along back of heel wore away within a few runs on the treadmill. Now I cannot wear them as there is no padding remaining and my heel is rubbing against a hard surface. Very disappointing
customer_reviews.author: DR LARRY JANKELOWITZ

customer_reviews.title: Wide size is Perfect for flat wide feet!
customer_reviews.text: I have very flat wide feet and no shoes EVER fit me right. I bought these on amazon after having looked at 20 different and different brands and I have to say these are the best fitting tennis shoes I have had in my life. Saucony is much more preoccupied with making good quality than how they appeal to the current fashion design, unlike Nike and Adidas that have just become a joke as far as I am concerned. Thank you Saucony! I am so glad to know there is still one shoe brand out there actually concerned about making quality running/tennis shoes. 12E all the way!
customer_reviews.author: Isaac James May

customer_reviews.title: 270 and find running in these painful after 10 or miles
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these shoes thinking I'd get the newer model of the same shoe I've been using (Triumph 10) To my surprise, the soles of these shoes are much firmer then my old 10's. I'm a bigger guy, 6'2, 270 and find running in these painful after 10 or miles. I much prefer my 10's or the 11's.
customer_reviews.author: M. Holt

customer_reviews.title: They fit well and are very comfortable. They have lot of cushion so my feet ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for work as I do a lot of walking. They fit well and are very comfortable. They have lot of cushion so my feet don't get too tired at the end of a shift. I have always like the fit of Saucony shoes since the toe-box is wider that most other brands and my toes don't feel too snug. Overall, I am very happy with these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Z and L

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes. I'm a big Saucony Grid Triumph fan
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes. I'm a big Saucony Grid Triumph fan. I've been running for 30 years and these are now my go to shoe as I get older. Cushioning is excellent in these. For about 6 years now, I've been using Sole Insoles inside of Saucony Running Shoes. The Sole provides the arch support I need for aging tendons while the Saucony provides the cushioning. Considering the fact that I'm still running after a 21 year career as a Marine, these shoes protect my knees and my hips.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Breath well and good fit but over cushioned
customer_reviews.text: Not bad for limited amounts of walking, but even as someone who likes a good amount of cushion, these feel too mushy to me. The fit is good and they breath well, but even on concrete they seem just a bit over cushioned to me.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Light cushy, a bit unstable at turns
customer_reviews.text: Tried them out at an indoor track today. Good plushy but firm midsole and heel support. It felt a little off when running the turns at higher speed, felt as if they wer sliding off. But the fit was fairly snug so the shoes stayed on. Light and breathable, did not feel clunky at all.Once you get used to the change in heel position they are barely noticeable (as they should be)
customer_reviews.author: Dorin Stancu

customer_reviews.title: These are so comfortable and no break-in necessary
customer_reviews.text: Changed from Asics to these since Asics changed their entire line. These are so comfortable and no break-in necessary .... in fact I bought 2 pair.
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: An excellent shoe
customer_reviews.text: The Saucony Triumph series of shoes are comfortable, fit in the length and width, and provide a stable platform as I jog. I am a size 12.5, medium width, and the Triumph 11 are true to size. This is my second pair of the Triuimph 11, as I wore out the previous pair. I have also had several pairs of the 7, 8, and 9 models.
customer_reviews.author: Bay Area Robert

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: I love Saucony but there are so many to choose from on Amazon. This pair is good and seems to have a bit more padding/bulkier than others
customer_reviews.author: smileyburg

customer_reviews.title: I run 18 miles a week and these shoes started ...
customer_reviews.text: I run 18 miles a week and these shoes started falling apart after three months. The soles are coming off and the back of the inside of the shoe is getting holes. Never had a shoe start to fall apart this quick. I have been running in this style of shoe for years. I still run in the other shoes that are much older.
customer_reviews.author: DWJersey

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable shoes for a high arch . . . .
customer_reviews.text: A good looking shoe that fits great and is very comfortable. I have a high arch and this shoe does a great job of providing the required arch support for my feet. I can wear these shoes all day long without my feet feeling fatigued.
customer_reviews.author: DEXTER COCHNAUER

customer_reviews.title: 2nd time around just as great!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair and they have been great! I trail run, hike and run the bike paths near my neighborhood in these shoes. I have low arches and these shoes give me the perfect support. Sometimes I will pull the insert out of these shoes to put them into other shoes that don't support my arches right. They are light, breathable and my favorite color. No complaints here.
customer_reviews.author: SD Green Guy

customer_reviews.title: Great shogreat comfortable shoes
customer_reviews.text: This is third pair of triumph shoes that I have bought , very comfortable, highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: jack bender

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable shoe.  Big in the toebox
customer_reviews.text: I've been running with Saucony pretty much exclusively for the last several years but my last set of Hurricanes were a bit large and never were quite as comfortable compared to the previous generation. I thought I'd give the Triumph a shot since I tend to under-pronate. Although these shoes are very comfortable, they definitely run wide in the toe box area.
customer_reviews.author: mark2203

customer_reviews.title: Solution for numbness
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my son who runs cross country in high school (16, 6'3", 160). I bought these shoes because of the larger toe box - he had been experiencing numbness in his feet after running a few miles in his other shoes. After reading many reviews, I chose the Saucony Mens Triumph 11, also ordering a half size larger than his normal sneakers, and it's made all the difference. He's run 26 miles in just the first 3 days of practice and no numbness or tingling, plus he finds them very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: SR

customer_reviews.title: The shoe looks pretty new considering the milage they have on them
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased the triumph 10 at a store and needed to retire them. I have since retired these shoes after putting over 550 miles on them. They held up well. The shoe looks pretty new considering the milage they have on them. I've since purchased another pair of these that I plan on getting another 500+ miles out of. Considering the price and the way they hold up, I'd say your getting a pretty good deal cent/mile. I've put about 17 miles on the new pair and right out of the gait I haven't had any issues with fit or comfort.
customer_reviews.author: R. Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Love 'Em!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this kicks! Extremely comfortable, I received compliments when I wore them and they can be worn all day. Didn't try to sprint in them but with the arch support, stability control and cushioning, I don't doubt they'd hold up well.
customer_reviews.author: T. Barker

customer_reviews.title: Great pair of runners
customer_reviews.text: Super cozy shoes. When you need that extra metal push to run further. Your not thinking about how much your feet hurt cause they don't. When the pair I have wear down I'll will purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: dennis d gant

customer_reviews.title: True Sizing.  Great value.  Color is accurate.
customer_reviews.text: Well constructed. Extremely comfortable. My Arch is on the higher side and these give me the perfect amount of running and everyday support.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable for wide foot under 200lbs runner.
customer_reviews.text: Good running shoes, great price. Used for short runs by an old, slow, heavy runner. They last and provide good comfort for about 4 months when running 3 times per week. I reorder via Amazon frequently b/c the price is great and there's no reason to risk injury with worn shoes -- at this price. They would probably last longer, though.
customer_reviews.author: MJC

customer_reviews.title: Great show
customer_reviews.text: Good product, the off set is great for folks with little arch
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Grisham

customer_reviews.title: Very happy!
customer_reviews.text: My son really likes these running shoes. He wears them out and I reorder them.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. S

customer_reviews.title: Head scratcher
customer_reviews.text: Loved the last version of these but for some reason my right shoe has pronounced heel slide and no amount of relaxing or tightening seems to help. My right calf keeps pumping up and I've gone back to my old triumphs and my GoRun Ride 3's to alleviate the pain. Maybe it's a break in thing. I'll update later
customer_reviews.author: Dell231

customer_reviews.title: My shoes broke after only 4 months of non intensive use.
customer_reviews.text: I made my purchase in August and I have to say that am very dissapointed because after being using it for 3 or 4 times per week, 35 to 45 kms per week in average during the last 4 months my shoes broke in both feet at the height of the little toe, so, definitely I'm pretty sureI will not buy Saucony again.
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo

customer_reviews.title: Love My Saucony Shoes
customer_reviews.text: I've gone through 5-6 pairs of these while marathon training over the past several years. When you find a running shoe that fits and feels right, buy multiple pairs so you are always in good shoes. I've been in Saucony shoes for a decade or more.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Impressed!
customer_reviews.text: I am a Nike guy, always have been. Not anymore. I've never owned a more comfortable pair of shoes. I wear sneakers all day everyday and typically I can't wait to get them off at the end of the day, achy knees and back. I don't take these shoes off until I'm getting into bed, and no pain. I highly recommend this shoe. I wear them while jogging, walking, doing yard work, around the pool, working out, and everything else. I have no complaints. That's the first time I've said that about a pair of shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Corey Migliore

customer_reviews.title: Wish they still made ‘em
customer_reviews.text: I run about 60 miles per month and have been wearing this shoe for several years. Sadly, they’re out of production, so I just buy up remaining stock when I find it.
customer_reviews.author: JRP

customer_reviews.title: A great fitting comfortable shoe.
customer_reviews.text: A great light weight training shoe. Will use these for a couple Ironman races in addition to the training. These are a favorite of mine.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoe, excessive forefoot cushion
customer_reviews.text: You may find that the cushioning in the forefoot makes the ball of your foot sore. (That was my experience!) I'm hoping that I can break these shoes in as time passes.
customer_reviews.author: Traveler

customer_reviews.title: Fixed my toe-strike problem
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair. I am a large framed guy, and I average around 150 miles per month, I had been having problems with toe striking causing stress on my foot. It stopped almost immediately upon using my 1st pair of these. They have above average cushioning and are very stable. The 8mm offset seems to do the trick for me.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Gribble

customer_reviews.title: Why look for another when what you have works
customer_reviews.text: I have owned many Saucony running shows as they fit and feel the way I expect them to. I know there are other good running shoes out there but why look if you have something that always works for you.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy B. Knight

customer_reviews.title: Buy these shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes. I was looking to replace an old pair of neon yellow Reebok running shoes and knew I could count on Saucony to deliver. Very comfortable, very green, very awesome.
customer_reviews.author: JL

customer_reviews.title: ... many sneakers and these saucony triumph 11 are the best yet. I have bought the same triumph 8 ...
customer_reviews.text: I must say I have many sneakers and these saucony triumph 11 are the best yet. I have bought the same triumph 8 twice and the 9 once. I will be buying another pair of these 11. I bought these 11 for running but they are just as comfortable for daily normal use.
customer_reviews.author: Felix

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Fit
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of the exact same model, so I knew what I would be getting, assuming they were genuine. They were. I do use an after-market arch support, but that's due to my issue, not the shoes. I would definitely buy this same model again.
customer_reviews.author: KuhlDad

customer_reviews.title: Great running / gym shoe
customer_reviews.text: Cheers, I have a very high instep so I need good support and the the Saucony Men's Triumph 11 are great. This is my second pair because I liked my first pair so much I had to replace the old pair with the same shoe. I use these shoes mainly for the gym.
customer_reviews.author: Nomore MS

customer_reviews.title: I had the Triumph 10 and really liked that pair
customer_reviews.text: I had the Triumph 10 and really liked that pair. These are firmer which I like but fit a bit more snuggly around the mid foot. I'm still using them and really don't mind the difference but if I were to buy another shoe, I would probably go back to the 10.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick OHearn

customer_reviews.title: Excellent comfort
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these after reading reviews and also from recommendations on these being good for runners with supination/or outside wear. First day I put them on about an hour before running just to check comfort. I forgot I had them on they are so light and comfortable. I also bought the cheapest ones based on the color scheme because I am only wearing them on my in-house treadmill/gym. Buying the least popular color scheme I paid $76. Really happy with this purchase so far.
customer_reviews.author: MMcK

customer_reviews.title: ... ran a marathon in these shoes and they were perfect! Did my last month of training in them
customer_reviews.text: Just ran a marathon in these shoes and they were perfect! Did my last month of training in them, which included a pair of 20-mile runs, and they offered fantastic cushioning and great stability. I am 6-0, 190 pounds, so larger runners would do well in these.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas M Grabarczyk

customer_reviews.title: Good running shoes
customer_reviews.text: Good running shoes with excellent cushioning. Good style and colors. Rubber on the soles has good grip. The only thing I didn't like about them was the placement of the Saucony logo seems to cause some discomfort that makes it feel like they're too narrow and rubs against the toes.
customer_reviews.author: K. Schomberg

customer_reviews.title: Great as always.
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing the Saucony triumph for over ten years now. It is the right shoe for my foot and the way I run. Saucony tends to run a bit wider in the tow box which is one of the things I like about them.
customer_reviews.author: Howard

customer_reviews.title: They are comfortable and provide a lot of support without feeling like ...
customer_reviews.text: I have flat feet and need a shoe with a large toe box area. These shoes fit the bill. They are comfortable and provide a lot of support without feeling like a huge heavy brick. Shipment was fast and the items was as described. Highly recommended. Thx.
customer_reviews.author: Richard P.

customer_reviews.title: What a GREAT shoe from Saucony!!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! Awesome!! Awesome!!! Absolutely love the Triumph 11's. The slime green is beautiful!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Milo

customer_reviews.title: These are a great neutral running shoe
customer_reviews.text: These are a great neutral running shoe. Im a heavy guy and these shoes have plenty of cushion. I have now sustained an injury and can only walk, but at 6 miles a day I couldn't ask for more. I love them! The colors are great too. The inside liner of this shoe is very comfortable. The lacing system makes it very nice to keep your feet in right.
customer_reviews.author: Tidz Roln

customer_reviews.title: Great fit, good cushion, perfect neutral running shoe for me
customer_reviews.text: I believe this is my 5th pair of Saucony Triumphs (I've had a Triumph 9 pair, a 10, and at least 3 pair of the 11's. I replace them every 300 miles, which for me means every 3 months or so. I *hope* they keep making these for a long, long time!
customer_reviews.author: Joe Litton

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for "heavy runners"
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing the Triumph for a number of years, since the Pro Grid Triumph 4 came out in 2004 and have never looked back. The cushioning is fantastic and the breath-ability is second to none. I have run many marathons and Ironman races in these and love them.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Stocks

customer_reviews.title: Like them!
customer_reviews.text: I feel them wide and a somewhat bigger tan I expected but they are light and they are nicely cusioned for a heel striker like me. So in general I am satisfied I only have to wear them with two socks, I always have to wait for a definite comment until my running tests them in a more challenging way. Like Them in general.
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo Guraieb

customer_reviews.title: Perfect.
customer_reviews.text: I know that these ones are perfect. But I made a mistake when I ordered. I need 10 and ordered 9. I never had the chance of using them.
customer_reviews.author: Hugo G. Cardey

customer_reviews.title: The shoe is comfortable and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I have a narrow foot so the toe area is a little loose. The show is comfortable and sturdy. Took a couple runs to break them in. I use super feet inserts with these shoes. I recommend these to anyone who doesn't want to pay too much for running shoes and still feel comfort while running.
customer_reviews.author: Pablo Macias

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Running Shoe
customer_reviews.text: So far the best running shoes I've had. I tend to get callouses on my feet from running but so far with these my old callouses are actually improving with no new ones coming in.
customer_reviews.author: tink185

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My favorite running shoe. I think they fit better than the updated versions.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: As such they are good. Cushioning is okay
customer_reviews.text: Only use the Saucony Triumph for running. They are a running shoe. Not walking, standing around or wearing while I am at work. Running. As such they are good. Cushioning is okay. Lightweight shoe so the cushioning cannot be too high. All in all a fair to good shoe. I do not think I would pay the full price for them; thanks to Amazon I paid $79.00, which is about $40.00 to $60.00 off fair market for these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Paul B Collins JR

customer_reviews.title: and these are great for my needs
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I wanted/needed. Exactly as advertised. I run or walk for exercise 6+ times per week, and these are great for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy

customer_reviews.title: I have high arches and I like to run
customer_reviews.text: I just received these shoes the other day. I have high arches and I like to run. I wore these shoes on a run the other day and they are extremely comfortable. I never realized how important it is to have the right pair of shoes till few months ago, I started noticing pain in my knees and legs. Purchasing these shoes was one of my best decisions.
customer_reviews.author: tihcaR

customer_reviews.title: this is the perfect fit for which I always had to compromise with ...
customer_reviews.text: The 12.5 size is usually not available in stores....this is the perfect fit for which I always had to compromise with a smaller or larger size when purchased from brick and mortar places....
customer_reviews.author: RvK

customer_reviews.title: Quality as always with Saucony!
customer_reviews.text: As long as this shoe is offered for sale I will buy them! Fit great and can always count on Saucony - excellent product and perfect fit!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Donahue

customer_reviews.title: Llight and well supporting
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are light, good supporting and look well. I really like them.
customer_reviews.author: Professional Contractor

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Value
customer_reviews.text: Perfect shoes for my feet, and an excellent value. I was "fit" for my shoe by a local expert, and I bought my first pair there. But I have found exceptional value purchasing a slightly older model for around half the price of my first pair.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Was a wonderful shoe and I prefer this to the models which came after
customer_reviews.author: Hamish Roberts

customer_reviews.title: this works best.
customer_reviews.text: I go through a pair of Triumph 11s about every few months. That's not a comment on the shoe, but just a reflection on the fact that I walk 4 miles per day, 7 days a week. I've tried some other shoes, but for my foot, this works best.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas A. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: for now they are very comfortable and wear all day with no trouble
customer_reviews.text: I've been trying for ages to find a suitable shoe that holds up to the demands of a Contractor. Only time will tell but, for now they are very comfortable and wear all day with no trouble.
customer_reviews.author: Bencro

customer_reviews.title: Good Saucony shoe.
customer_reviews.text: Light weight. Snug fit. Have about 30 miles on them. Smooth sailing.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey C. Preston

customer_reviews.title: Finally made the change to Triumph 11
customer_reviews.text: I resisted changing from the Triumph 10's to these 11's. I am comfortable with the switch. Great shoe for neutral runners. Roomy toe box which is a must for me. I always get the best ride from Saucony.
customer_reviews.author: Ernest C Rosenbaum III

customer_reviews.title: Very Comfortable Sneakers with Great Support for All Day!
customer_reviews.text: Great sneakers. They fit perfectly and are extremely comfortable, even if they are a bit over priced.
customer_reviews.author: Let's Go Cardinals!

customer_reviews.title: Excellent shoes with great support
customer_reviews.text: This is my first time buying Saucony brand. They are extremely comfortable. Looking forward to run half marathon with them. Looking forward to buy 2 more pairs. I run over 30 miles a week.
customer_reviews.author: Michael C. Yip

customer_reviews.title: My preference... Saucony Ride
customer_reviews.text: Fit charts shows the Triumph was the same fit as the Saucony Ride. Not true. The toe box is larger and more pointed. Not the fit I expected. Going back to Ride model.
customer_reviews.author: David J. Neuman

customer_reviews.title: Previously I had a pair of these and the 'superfeet' ...
customer_reviews.text: Previously I had a pair of these and the 'superfeet' inserts. I bought the shoes and the 'superfeet' inserts again and it all fits together perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: K. Metz

customer_reviews.title: Pretty decent running shoes
customer_reviews.text: Pretty nice running shoes. Not as comfortable or arch supportive as I'd like, but they're good shoes.
customer_reviews.author: J. King

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My perfect running shoe! Love these shoes, awesome fit and very comfortable!
customer_reviews.author: Billy

customer_reviews.title: Comforablet and Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I'm a big guy and I'm brutal on shoes, especially ones that I try to run in. These keep the pain at bay and allow me to continue training. The fit is pretty much as expected. I've heard they're fairly heavy, but I've never really noticed. Hold up very well and are incredibly comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Domenic Wlodyka

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: ol school - but my favorite sauconys... good fit and comfort for long distance running (70+ mi/week)
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: I wish I knew these shoes where 1/2 size to small, now I can't wear them or return them.
customer_reviews.author: David A. Meyers

customer_reviews.title: They get better every year
customer_reviews.text: Just got them and can't wait to run in them. When I put them on, my feet felt at home. I have run many miles and marathons in Saucony's Triumph series over the years. They get better every year.
customer_reviews.author: tcnelson

customer_reviews.title: Tread wears to quick
customer_reviews.text: Good shoes However... Foam tread wore out QUICK. Probably got a hundred miles out of them max
customer_reviews.author: Phil Magic

customer_reviews.title: These shoes do give good stability. My husband liked them
customer_reviews.text: These shoes do give good stability. My husband liked them. It's hard for him to find a good running shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: Great running shoe.
customer_reviews.text: I was fitted by a local running shop. These felt the best, but they suggested about a half size bigger for marathon training. I'm on my second pair because I ran the other ones out. Parallel lacing helped my feet. These shoes have been great.
customer_reviews.author: Ben W.

customer_reviews.title: Beware of Narrow Arches
customer_reviews.text: Initially these shoes were great for runs less than 5 miles. Once I started to go over 5 miles, I started to get blisters on my left arch. I did some more in-depth research and I found other reviews describing the same issue. Seems Saucony is known for having narrow arches. I have since stopped using these all together and have gone with the Mizuno Wave Rider 18, which I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Triple A

customer_reviews.title: He said the most comfortable shoes he has ever had
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my brother. He stands at work all day. He said the most comfortable shoes he has ever had. Thank you for carrying such great products.
customer_reviews.author: Marlene Morris

customer_reviews.title: Superb packing good quality and good price
customer_reviews.text: Got this for $88... Superb packing good quality and good price. In canada sports check was selling this for $175. I am happy i can take care of my health. I can consistently run for 5 km. before i used the wrong cheap shoes and used to get injured even after 3km run. This shoe is awesome esp for heavy and greeny runners like me.
customer_reviews.author: Rahul

customer_reviews.title: Continued quality
customer_reviews.text: These sneakers are handsome, light and comfortable. I have always been a fan of Saucony and am pleased that they continue to put out a good product.
customer_reviews.author: G.Harris

customer_reviews.title: Just can't say enough about Saucony's Triumph line. I've ...
customer_reviews.text: Just can't say enough about Saucony's Triumph line. I've tried so many others but these just work so well mile after mile.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Doherty

customer_reviews.title: excellent running shoes
customer_reviews.text: great running shoes. Saucony is my go to shoe for running. I am 6 foot and 190 pound and very fit. these are comfortable
customer_reviews.author: E. Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Ultimate running shoe at this price
customer_reviews.text: Light shoes great support. I use these for running at the gym. They have great support and traction and don't give around corners.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: Good ole reliable.
customer_reviews.text: My husband has been ordering this particular brand of Saucony sneaker for years. He is a 200 pound man and these sneakers give him the support he needs to jog, bike ride, elliptical, walk and lift weights. They last about 6 months- he exercises about 4 days a week. We have yet to find something that works better for his wide, chunky feet, too.
customer_reviews.author: LBinBah

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable running shoes I've owned!
customer_reviews.text: These are my third pair of Saucony's. Been wearing the Virrata 2's and when I started looking for new shoes I thought I'd try something else. The Triumph 11's are amazingly comfortable! More comfortable than the Virrata 2's and only a couple of ounces heavier. Had the shoes a week and absolutely love them!
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great support, cushion, and fit, but could be more durable.
customer_reviews.text: Very good shoes, lots of support and cushion. They didn't last as long as some shoes from other brands, but I run a lot,and put a lot of wear and tear on shoes. I would still recommend these shoes, though.
customer_reviews.author: ToWeR

customer_reviews.title: Quite satisfied overall.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not an athlete, just wearing this pair of shoes for daily usage. They are quite comfy, actually. Overall, I'm very satisfied, except that the shoelaces appear cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Feng Feng

customer_reviews.title: My husband liked the shoes
customer_reviews.text: My husband liked the shoes, but thought they ran a little big compared to other brands. We will exchange for the next size down. He said they were very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Joanna

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight with support
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight, good arch support although I added more. I like that these give pretty good support but are still mesh so they are lightweight. Good shoe.
customer_reviews.author: R. Beaton

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice fitting shoes. Comfortable. The only complaint is the sole seems somewhat stiff... not real flexible.
customer_reviews.author: Bill L

customer_reviews.title: Excellent cushioning .
customer_reviews.text: These are excellent shoes . Very comfortable. Looking forward to run my first full marathon on them
customer_reviews.author: juan miguel Bautista Dom Rep.

product_meta.title: Saucony Men's Triumph 11 Running Shoes-Blue/Black/Green/White, Size
feature_bullets: Lace-up running shoe featuring breathable mesh upper with HydraMAX moisture-wicking collar lining
